column4: i have gnome-media, but I don't have the volume control applet. How come?
you need the indicator-applet
I don't have that executable
I have /usr/lib/indicator-applet/ but I don't have anything in a bin directory
you need to add the applet to one of your panels
that's where the volume-applet hooks itself these days
the problem is that it doesn't show up in the "add to panel" list
!in | JJacs
The notify applet doesnt? I run swedish locale, but it shows as something like "notification area" for me
oh. who would have thought that the 'volume indicator' is called 'notificator'
I have it now
it's not just for volume, various other apps hook into the notification area as well
I see now, it also lists email
yep :)
do you also know an app, that let's me switch between differen audio output channels (e.g., switch from internal sound to the headset and back?)
the normal volume applet should let you do that
Settings -> output
yes, but I need to go into the audio settings
ah you mean like a quick switch
I was looking for a simple applet that let's one easily switch
yes
well ideally, it should do that automatically when you insert headphones, but sometimes it doesnt detect the switch getting triggered... I think there's some workarounds/fixes for that
But to answer the question, no I dont know of a dedicated app to do it
thanks
